title: 103_hr58
content: The Act may be cited as the "Merchant Marine Memorial Enhancement Act of 1993" and pertains to conveyance vessels. The "Merchant Marine Memorial Enhancement Act of 1993" allows the Secretary of Transportation to convey certain vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to nonprofit organizations for use as memorials to merchant mariners. The vessels must be over 4,000 displacement tons, have no government use, and be scheduled for scrapping. The organizations must agree to sell the vessel for scrap and use the proceeds to refurbish a Liberty Ship or Victory Ship memorial. The "Merchant Marine Memorial Enhancement Act of 1993" allows the Secretary of Transportation to convey certain vessels from the National Defense Reserve Fleet to nonprofit organizations for use as memorials to merchant mariners. The organizations must agree to sell the vessel for scrap and use the proceeds to refurbish a Liberty Ship or Victory Ship memorial. Amounts returned to the United States shall be deposited in the Vessel Operations Revolving Fund. The Secretary shall deliver each vessel conveyed in its current condition without cost to the Government. The authority to convey vessels expires 2 years after the enactment of the Act. SEC. 3. DOCUMENTATION OF VESSELS. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for specific vessels listed by their official numbers or registration numbers. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for specific vessels listed by their official numbers or registration numbers, including EUROPA STAR, EUROPA SUN, GAZELA OF PHILADELPHIA, GRAY, GRIZZLY PROCESSOR, GUSTO, GYPSY COWBOY, IMPATIENT LADY, ISLAND GIRL, JULIET, KALENA, LAURISA, LIBBY ROSE, LISERON, MARINE STAR, MARINER, and MARY B. The vessels listed by their official numbers or registration numbers are: MARY B, MOONSHINE, MYSTIQUE, NORTHERN LIGHT, PAI NUI, PANDACEA, PELICAN, PLAY PRETTY, PRINCE OF TIDES II, RBOAT, SABLE, SERENA, SHILOH, SIDEWINDER, SWELL DANCER, TESSA, TOP DUCK, and VIKING. The foreign-flag vessel H851 is allowed to engage in coastwise trade to transport an offshore drilling platform jacket. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels LADY CHARL II and LINETTE with coastwise and Great Lakes endorsement. The Secretary of Transportation may issue a certificate of documentation with a coastwise endorsement for the vessel M/V TWIN DRILL (Panama official number 8356-PEXT-2) if the vessel undergoes a major conversion in a US shipyard costing more than 3 times the purchase value before the conversion, completed before June 30, 1995, and the person documenting the vessel contracts with a US shipyard to construct an additional vessel of equal or greater capacity within 12 months for delivery within 36 months. The Secretary of Transportation may issue certificates of documentation for vessels with specific endorsements, allowing for foreign registry transfers and special tonnage considerations. The Secretary of Commerce may deploy a Physical Ocean Real-Time System in Galveston Bay and the Houston Ship Channel within 180 days. The Secretary of Transportation will establish a 3-year pilot program for Sealift Training at the Massachusetts Maritime Academy.
